result.execSummary:
The defendant Ali E Barry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ali E Barry

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:35 PM Defendant Ali E Barry in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Ali E Barry. 
2021CM000070, 2021CM000104, 2022CM000028 & 21CM69 tracking together:
Atty Frank states that the matters are resolved.  Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1 in 22CM28 & Ct. 1 in 21CM104:  All other counts and cases to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CM28 & Ct. 1 in 21CM104 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. All other counts and cases to be dismissed and read-in.

State has complied with victim notification requirements. Atty Juech states that a victim impact statement was filed in February.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1 in 22CM28 Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Report on or before August 12, 2022 by 7:00pm, clean & sober. 
May transfer to Dane County or Milwaukee County
Court Costs = $243.00 
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00
Credit = 2 days (22CM28)
Cash bond to be applied
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office 

Ct. 1 in 21CM104:  Court orders 15 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Report on or before August 12, 2022 by 7:00pm, clean & sober. 
May transfer to Dane County or Milwaukee County
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00 
Credit = 0 days
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office 

Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 22CM28 to be dismissed and read-in
21CM70 to be dismissed and read-in
21CM69 to be dismissed and read-in

3:18 PM Defendant Ali E Barry in court.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Ali E Barry. 
2021CM000069, 2021CM000070, 2021CM000104 & 22CM28 tracking together:
BY THE COURT:  Warrants quashed based on the appearance today.

Atty Frank states that his client recently started employment and got his court dates mixed up.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate all the bonds.

Atty Frank states that he did receive an offer covering all cases and projects the matters will be resolved.
BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing in-person
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ali E Barry not in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Ali E Barry. 
2021CM000069, 2021CM000070, 2022CM000028 & 21CM104 tracking together:
Atty Frank has no offer that covers all cases at this time and asks for a reset of today's hearing.  Atty Burdon responds.  Atty Frank asks for a stay of the warrants until the end of the week.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized in all cases
Status hearing on May 24, 2022 at 11:45 am.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

03:20 PM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ali E Barry appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
  Attorney Ryan Frank appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
Atty Frank asks that the court appoint him on this case as well.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant asks that Atty Frank be appointed.

BY THE COURT:  Atty Ryan Frank is appointed to the case.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2022

  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Juech asks for a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Frank makes bail arguments and asks for a signature bond

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  Status hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
